Class ChartThemes

java.lang.Object
com.arbergashi.charts.api.ChartThemes
public final class ChartThemes extends Object
Central access point for the framework's built-in theme defaults.

Framework contract: Core rendering code must never depend on demo resources or application-specific Look&Feel state. Instead it should request a theme from the active PlotContext and only fall back to the stable defaults exposed here.

Available Themes (v2.0)

  • dark - Default dark theme
  • light - Default light theme
  • nord - Nord color palette (arctic, bluish)
  • dracula - Dracula theme (purple accents)
  • monokai - Monokai Pro colors
  • obsidian - Deep black, high contrast
  • solarized-dark - Solarized dark variant
  • solarized-light - Solarized light variant
  • github-dark - GitHub dark mode colors
  • medical - IEC 60601 compliant (green grid)

Usage Example

// Get theme by name
ChartTheme theme = ChartThemes.getTheme("nord");
panel.setTheme(theme);

// Or use specific getter
panel.setTheme(ChartThemes.getNordTheme());
Since:
2026-01-01
Version:
2.0.0
Author:
Arber Gashi

    • getMedicalTheme

      public static ChartTheme getMedicalTheme()
      Gets the Medical theme (IEC 60601 compliant).

      Green-on-black color scheme compliant with medical device standards. Suitable for ECG, EEG, and patient monitoring displays.

      Returns:
      the Medical theme
      Since:
      2.0.0

    • getTheme

      public static ChartTheme getTheme(String name)
      Gets a theme by name.

      Available theme names:

      • dark - Default dark theme
      • light - Default light theme
      • nord - Nord arctic theme
      • dracula - Dracula purple theme
      • monokai - Monokai Pro theme
      • obsidian - High contrast black theme
      • solarized-dark - Solarized dark variant
      • solarized-light - Solarized light variant
      • github-dark - GitHub dark mode
      • medical - IEC 60601 compliant
      Parameters:
      name - the theme name (case-insensitive)
      Returns:
      the theme, or the default dark theme if not found
      Since:
      2.0.0

    • getAvailableThemes

      public static String[] getAvailableThemes()
      Returns all available theme names.
      Returns:
      array of theme names
      Since:
      2.0.0

    • registerTheme

      public static void registerTheme(String name, ChartTheme theme)
      Registers a custom theme.

      Allows applications to add their own themes to the registry.

      Parameters:
      name - the theme name
      theme - the theme instance
      Since:
      2.0.0
